parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • widget_read
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.
parameters.name: x-api-user

parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account
parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user

parameters.description: The group identifier, as returned by the group creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch groups.
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: A query parameter to fetch all the hidden web forms along with the visible web forms. Default value is false.
parameters.name: showHiddenWidgets

parameters.description: Used to navigate through the pages. If not provided, returns the first page.
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.description: Number of intended items in the response page. If not provided, it is decided by the application settings.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: An optional field to provide the comma-separated list of parent domain urls where the returned URLs may be iframed. If provided with non-empty and valid list of parent domain urls, it will be used to allow framing for the same. By default the value is null and the Acrobat Sign pages will not be viewable in an iframe.
parameters.name: frameParent

get.summary: Retrieves web forms for a user.

parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • widget_write
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.
parameters.name: x-api-user

parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account
parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user

post.description: This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new web form. You can create a web form in one of the 3 mentioned states: a) DRAFT - to incrementally build the web form, b) AUTHORING - to add/edit form fields in the web form, c) ACTIVE - to immediately host the web form. You can use the PUT /widgets/{widgetId}/state endpoint to transition a web form between the above mentioned states. An allowed transition would follow the any of the following sequences: DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.

requestBody.description: Information about the web form that you want to create.

post.summary: Creates a web form and and returns the widgetId in the response to the client.

An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • widget_read - web form read is always required
  • user_login - Required additionally if the autoLoginUser parameter is set to true
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

post.summary: Retrieves the requested views for a web form.

email.description: The email address of the user

fullName.description: Full name of this account sharer.

permissions.description: A list of permissions given for this account sharing.

userId.description: A unique identifier of the user resource for REST APIs as issued by Acrobat Sign.

documentsImageUrlsInfo.description: A list of original document image URLs info.

company.description: Company of the CC participant, if available.

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the web form

hidden.description: True if the web form is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the CC participant, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the CC participant of the web form.

self.description: True if the CC participant of the web form is the same user that is calling the API.

ccInfoList.description: List of emails of all the CC participant of the web form

autoLoginUser.description: Auto LogIn Flag. If true, the URL returned will automatically log the user in. If false, the URL returned will require the credentials. By default its value is false

frameParent.description: An optional field to provide the comma-separated list of parent domain urls where the returned URLs may be iframed. If provided with non-empty and valid list of parent domain urls, it will be used to allow framing for the same. By default the value is null and the Acrobat Sign pages will not be viewable in an iframe. frameParent will be ignored for SIGNING view

noChrome.description: No Chrome Flag. If true, the embedded page is shown without a navigation header or footer. If false, the standard page header and footer will be present. By default its value is false

company.description: The company of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

createdDate.description: The date when the participant was added. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: Email of the participant. In case of modifying a participant set (PUT) this is a required field. In case of GET, this is the required field and will always be returned unless it is a fax workflow (legacy agreements) that were created using fax as input

hidden.description: True if the agreement is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true. Ignored (not required) if modifying a participant (PUT).

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant. This will be returned as part of Get call.

name.description: The name of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant.

self.description: True if this participant is the same user that is calling the API. Returned as part of Get. Ignored (not required) if modifying a participant set (PUT).

userId.description: The user ID of the participant. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant set. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (e.g. email). All participants in the array belong to the same set

order.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specified for hybrid routing). This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

providerParticipantSetInfo.description: Represents the attributes related to a unknown participant's provider.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver etc.). This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

providerDesc.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Description. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls.

providerId.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Id. When replacing a participant that has DIG_ID authentication specified, you must supply a provider id for the new participant.

providerName.description: Digital Identity Gateway Provider Name. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls.

cloudProviderIp.description: Cloud Provider IP for digital signing

cloudProviderUrl.description: Cloud Provider URL for digital signing

company.description: Company name captured during digital signing
Displays the name of the company of the user, if available

email.description: Displays the email of the user

fullName.description: Displays the full name of the user, if available.

displayUserSetMemberInfos.description: Displays the info about user set

createdDate.description: The date the document was created

id.description: ID of the document. In case of PUT call, this is the only field that is accepted in Document structure. Name and mimeType are ignored in case of PUT call

mimeType.description: mimeType of the original file. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

name.description: Name of the original document uploaded. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

numPages.description: Number of pages in the document

imageSize.description: ImageSize corresponding to the imageUrl returned

imageURLs.description: A list of image url (one per page).

imagesAvailable.description: true if images for the associated image size is available, else false.

documentImageUrlsList.description: A list of documents image URLs.

additionalParticipantSetsInfo.description: List of all the participants in the web form except web form signer

authFailureInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the error page the web form signer will be taken after failing to authenticate

ccs.description: A list of one or more email addresses that you want to copy on this transaction. The email addresses will each receive an email when the final agreement created through web form is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

completionInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the web form signer will be taken to after performing desired action on the web form

createdDate.description: Date when web form was created. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

creatorEmail.description: Email of web form creator. Only returned in GET response. Cannot be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

creatorName.description: Name of web form creator. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be used to create the web form. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined before the web form is created. Library documents are not permitted. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

groupId.description: The ID of the group to which the web form belongs to. If not provided during creation, primary group of the creator will be used

id.description: A resource identifier that can be used to uniquely identify the web form in other apis. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this web form.  Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this web form - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the web form creator

name.description: The name of the web form that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

ownerEmail.description: Email of web form owner. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the web form owner. It will be ignored in POST requests

ownerName.description: Name of web form owner. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

securityOption.description: Secondary security parameters for the web form

state.description: The state in which the web form should land. For example in order to create a web form in DRAFT state, field should be DRAFT. The state field will never get returned in GET /widgets/{ID} and will be ignored if provided in PUT /widgets/{ID} call. The eventual status of the web form can be obtained from GET /widgets/ID

status.description: Status of the Web Form. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

widgetInActiveInfo.description: The custom message which will be displayed to the user or the URL to which user will be redirected when the web form is accessed in a disabled state. This can only be specified in PUT request

widgetParticipantSetInfo.description: Represents web form participant for whom email should not be provided

document.description: A document that is associated with the web form. This field cannot be provided in POST call. In case of GET call, this is the only field returned in the response

notarize.description: Indicates that this document needs to be notarized

transientDocumentId.description: ID for a transient document that will be added to the web form

urlFileInfo.description: URL for an external document to add to the agreement

FormField.description: A form field for an agreement.

assignee.description: Who the field is assigned to. Valid values are a participant set id, null, "NOBODY", "PREFILL" or "EVERYONE". If set to a participant set id, then any member of that participant set may fill out the field. "NOBODY" indicates that the field may not be filled by anybody (e.g. autopopulated fields like transaction number). "PREFILL" indicates that the field will be filled by the sender before the agreement is sent out for signing. "EVERYONE" exists only in hyperlink fields currently and indicates that it is assigned to all participants. null indicates that anybody may fill out the field. If the propeerty isn't specified, it is treated as null.

backgroundColor.description: Background color of the form field in RGB or HEX format

borderColor.description: Color of the border of the field in RGB or HEX format

borderStyle.description: Style of the border of the field.

borderWidth.description: Width of the border of the field in default user space units

calculated.description: true if this field's value is calculated from an expression, else false

conditionalAction.description: A predicate (or set of predicates) that determines whether this field is visible and enabled.

contentType.description: Content Type of the form field.

currency.description: A currency ISO code. Only applicable for payment form fields. Should be one of the currencies supported in the payment integration merchant accounts.

defaultValue.description: Default value of the form field

displayFormat.description: Format of the value of the field to be displayed based on the displayFormatType property.

displayFormatType.description: Format type of the text field.

displayLabel.description: Display label attached to the field

fontColor.description: Font color of the form field in RGB or HEX format

fontName.description: Font name of the form field

fontSize.description: Font size of the form field in points

hiddenOptions.description: Text values which are hidden in a drop down form field

hyperlink.description: Hyperlink-specific data (e.g. as url, link type)

inputType.description: Input type of the form field

locations.description: All locations in a document where the form field is placed

masked.description: true if the input entered by the signer has to be masked (like password), false if it shouldn't be

maskingText.description: Text to mask the masked form field

maxLength.description: Maximum length of the input text field in terms of no. of characters

maxValue.description: Upper bound of the number that can be entered by the signer

minLength.description: Minimum length of the input text field in terms of no. of characters

minValue.description: Lower bound of the number that can be entered by the signer

name.description: The name of the form field

radioCheckType.description: The type of radio button (if field is radio button, identified by inputType).

readOnly.description: true if it is a read-only field, else false

required.description: true if it is a mandatory field to be filled by the signer, else false

tooltip.description: Tooltip text for the form field

urlOverridable.description: For web form text fields only - true if the default value may come from the URL, else false

validation.description: Rule for validating the field value.

validationData.description: Further data for validating input with regards to the field's specified format. The contents and interpretation of formatData depends on the value of validation.

validationErrMsg.description: Error message to be shown to the signer if filled value doesn't match the validations of the form field

valueExpression.description: Expression to calculate value of the form field

visible.description: If set to false, then the form field is hidden.  Otherwise, it is visible.

visibleOptions.description: Text values which are visible in a drop down form field

FormFieldConditionPredicate.description: A predicate used to determine whether the condtion succeeds

fieldLocationIndex.description: Index of the location of the form field used in the predicate

fieldName.description: Name of the field whose value is the basis of predicate

operator.description: Operator to be applied on the value of the predicate field.

value.description: Value to compare against the value of the predicate's form field, using the specified operator

FormFieldConditionalAction.description: Conditional actions to perfom on this form field.

action.description: Action to show/hide the form field is to be taken on the basis of evaluation of conditions.

anyOrAll.description: It indicates if any one of the conditions or all of them have to be true.

predicates.description: The predicates to be evaluated in order to determine whether this condition is true

FormFieldHyperlink.description: Hyperlink-specific data for hyperlink form fields

documentLocation.description: Location on the document pointed by the link in case of INTERNAL type link

linkType.description: Type of link in an agreement.

url.description: URL, in case of EXTERNAL type link

height.description: Height of the form field in default user space units

left.description: No. of default user space units from left of the page for form field placement

pageNumber.description: Number of the page where form field has to be placed, starting from 1.

top.description: No. of default user space units from bottom of the page for form field placement

width.description: Width of the form field in default user space units

FormFieldPutInfo.description: Information required to add or replace agreement form fields

fields.description: The list of fields to update or replace.

accountSharers.description: A list of account sharer in relation to the api caller and this resource.

nextCursor.description: Used to navigate to the next page. If notreturned, there are no further pages.

authenticationMethod.description:
The authentication method for the participants to have access to view and sign the document. When replacing a participant that has PASSWORD or PHONE authentication specified, you must supply a password or phone number for the new participant, and you cannot change the authentication method. 
For unknown participants, only email based authentication is allowed. Hence, only NONE authenticaiton method is permitted

notaryAuthentication.description: The authentication method of the notary participant to the notary

password.description: The password required for the participant to view and sign the document. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. The password will not be returned in GET call. When replacing a participant that has PASSWORD authentication specified, you must supply a password for the new participant.

phoneInfo.description: The phoneInfo required for the participant to view and sign the document

email.description: Email of the participant. It should be blank for the unknown participants.

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls. The Id might be null in draft state

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant

comment.description: Comment describing how the API caller established the signer's identity - will appear in the audit trail

email.description: The email address of the person who will be receiving this web form

expiration.description: Expiration date for the personalization of this web form. After this date, the identity of the signer will not be assumed by Acrobat Sign. Format should be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2022-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

reusable.description: Should the intended signer be allowed to sign this web form more than once

countryCode.description: The numeric country calling code (ISD code) required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication type is PHONE

countryIsoCode.description: The country ISO Alpha-2 code required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE

phone.description: The phone number required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE. When replacing a participant that has PHONE authentication specified, you must supply a phone number for the new participant.

actionDescription.description: The description for the provider participant who is responsible to provide details like name, email for the unknown participant.

actionRequired.description: It indicates whether it is mandatory or not for the provider participant to provide the details for the unknown participant

email.description: The email address of the participant

name.description: The full name of the participant

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

openPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to secure the PDF document. Note that Acrobat Sign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties

company.description: Company of the creator, if available.

createdDate.description: The date when the sender was added. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: Email of the creator of the web form.

hidden.description: True if the web form is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the creator, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the creator of the web form.

self.description: True if the creator of the web form is the same user that is calling the API.

userId.description: The user ID of the sender. This will be returned as part of GET call but is ignored if passed as part of PUT call.

email.description: The email address of the member with whom the agreement will be shared
The email address that was requested

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant

company.description: Company of the sharee participant of the web form, if available.

email.description: Email of the sharee participant of the web form.

hidden.description: True if the web form is hidden for the user that is calling the API. Only returned if self is true.

name.description: Name of the sharee participant of the web form, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the sharee participant of the web form.

self.description: True if the Share participant of the web form is the same user that is calling the API.

sharerParticipantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant who shared the web form.

mimeType.description: The mime type of the referenced file, used to determine if the file can be accepted and the necessary conversion steps can be performed

name.description: The original system file name of the document being sent

url.description: A publicly accessible URL for retrieving the raw file content

hidden.description: True if agreement is hidden for the user

id.description: The unique identifier of a web form

javascript.description: The embedded javascript code of the web form

modifiedDate.description: The date on which the web form was last modified. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

name.description: The name of the web form.

status.description: The web form status (AUTHORING, ACTIVE, DRAFT, DISABLED)

url.description: The hosted url of the web form

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

userWidgetList.description: An array of web form items

enabled.description: For accounts set up for document vaulting and the option to enable per agreement, this determines whether the document is to be vaulted

visibility.description: Specifies the visibility. The possible values are HIDE or SHOW

electronicSealId.description: ID of the sealing credential, which can be obtained through GET /autoseals call.

id.description: The unique identifier of the Web form participant. This will be ignored as part of POST or PUT calls.The Id might be null in draft state,

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (email, e.g.) for all the additional participants in the web form. If the email of the participant is unknown at the time of web form creation, the email should be left empty. Required, unless ParticipantSet has the ELECTRONIC_SEALER role,

order.description: Index indicating position at which signing group needs to sign. Additional participant to sign at first place is assigned a index of 1. Web Form participant should not have any order specified. Web Form participant should not have any email address and and can not have phone authentication applied. Different signingOrder specified in input should form a valid consecutive increasing sequence of integers. Otherwise signingOrder will be considered invalid,

providerParticipantSetInfo.description: Represents all the attributes related to the unknown participant and its provider. If it is defined then the participant will be treated as an unknown participant.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver, etc.) Web Form First Participant will only have roles - Signer, Approver, Acceptor and Form Filler

displayDate.description: The display date for the agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

displayParticipantSetInfos.description: The most relevant current user set for the agreement. It is typically the next signer if the agreement is from the current user, or the sender if received from another user

esign.description: True if this is an e-sign document

hidden.description: True if agreement is hidden for the user

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement.If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

latestVersionId.description: A version ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the agreement

parentId.description: The parent id of a bulk send child *OR* the originating id of a web form agreement instance

status.description: The current status of the document from the perspective of the originator

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the web form

additionalParticipantSetsInfo.description: List of all the participants in the web form except web form signer

authFailureInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the error page the web form signer will be taken after failing to authenticate

ccs.description: A list of one or more email addresses that you want to copy on this transaction. The email addresses will each receive an email when the final agreement created through web form is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

completionInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the web form signer will be taken to after performing desired action on the web form

createdDate.description: Date when web form was created. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

creatorEmail.description: Email of web form creator. Only returned in GET response. Cannot be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

creatorName.description: Name of web form creator. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be used to create the web form. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined before the web form is created. Library documents are not permitted. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

groupId.description: The ID of the group to which the web form belongs to. If not provided during creation, primary group of the creator will be used

id.description: A resource identifier that can be used to uniquely identify the web form in other apis. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this web form.  Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this web form - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the web form creator

name.description: The name of the web form that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

ownerEmail.description: Email of web form owner. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the web form owner. It will be ignored in POST requests

ownerName.description: Name of web form owner. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

securityOption.description: Secondary security parameters for the web form

state.description: The state in which the web form should land. For example in order to create a web form in DRAFT state, field should be DRAFT. The state field will never get returned in GET /widgets/{ID} and will be ignored if provided in PUT /widgets/{ID} call. The eventual status of the web form can be obtained from GET /widgets/ID

status.description: Status of the Web Form. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

widgetInActiveInfo.description: The custom message which will be displayed to the user or the URL to which user will be redirected when the web form is accessed in a disabled state. This can only be specified in PUT request

widgetParticipantSetInfo.description: Represents web form participant for whom email should not be provided

WidgetCreationResponse.description: A JSON object describing the web form

id.description: The unique identifier of web form which can be used to retrieve the data entered by the signers.

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that created the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that created the event

actingUserName.description: The name of the acting user

comment.description: The event comment. For RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates the event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to the participant

date.description: The date of the audit event. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

description.description: A description of the audit event

device.description: The device used for the event.

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that generated the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

devicePhoneNumber.description: Phone number from the device used when the participation is completed on a mobile phone

digitalSignatureInfo.description: This is present for ESIGNED events when the participation is signed digitally

initiatingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

initiatingUserName.description: Full name of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that is the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantRole.description: Role assumed by all participants in the participant set the participant belongs to (signer, approver etc.).

reminderParticipants.description: A list of one or more participants who received the reminders

replacedParticipantEmail.description: Email of the user that was replaced by the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

replacedParticipantName.description: Full name of the user that was replaced by the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

signerNewName.description: Signer changed name at signing : new name used to sign.

signerOldName.description: Signer changed name at signing : name used previous to signing.

signingReason.description: Signing reason captured during ESIGN or DIGSIGN

synchronizationId.description: A unique identifier linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offline signing events and synchronization events, else null)

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

vaultProviderName.description: Name of the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

WidgetFormFields.description: A JSON list of all of the fields for a form

fields.description: List of the form fields in an agreement

message.description: Display this custom message to the user when the web form is accessed. Note that this can contain wiki markup to include clickable links in the message. This is required if redirectUrl is not provided. Both message and redirectUrl cannot be specified.

redirectUrl.description: Redirect the user to this URL when the web form is accessed. This is required if message is not provided. Both message and redirectUrl cannot be specified.

additionalParticipantSetsInfo.description: List of all the participants in the web form except web form signer

authFailureInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the error page the web form signer will be taken after failing to authenticate

ccs.description: A list of one or more email addresses that you want to copy on this transaction. The email addresses will each receive an email when the final agreement created through web form is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

completionInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the web form signer will be taken to after performing desired action on the web form

createdDate.description: Date when web form was created. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

creatorEmail.description: Email of web form creator. Only returned in GET response. Cannot be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

creatorName.description: Name of web form creator. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be used to create the web form. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined before the web form is created. Library documents are not permitted. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

groupId.description: The ID of the group to which the web form belongs to. If not provided during creation, primary group of the creator will be used

id.description: A resource identifier that can be used to uniquely identify the web form in other apis. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

isDocumentRetentionApplied.description: Is document retention applied for this resource.  If provided in POST or PUT, it will simply be ignored.

lastEventDate.description: The date of the last event that occurred for this web form.  Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

locale.description: The locale associated with this web form - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the web form creator

name.description: The name of the web form that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

ownerEmail.description: Email of web form owner. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

ownerId.description: The unique identifier of the web form owner. It will be ignored in POST requests

ownerName.description: Name of web form owner. It will be ignored in POST/PUT requests

securityOption.description: Secondary security parameters for the web form

state.description: The state in which the web form should land. For example in order to create a web form in DRAFT state, field should be DRAFT. The state field will never get returned in GET /widgets/{ID} and will be ignored if provided in PUT /widgets/{ID} call. The eventual status of the web form can be obtained from GET /widgets/ID

status.description: Status of the Web Form. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Acrobat Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

widgetInActiveInfo.description: The custom message which will be displayed to the user or the URL to which user will be redirected when the web form is accessed in a disabled state. This can only be specified in PUT request

widgetParticipantSetInfo.description: Represents web form participant for whom email should not be provided

additionalParticipantSets.description: Information about the web form additional participant Sets

ccsInfo.description: Information of CC participants of the web form.

creatorInfo.description: Information of the creator of the web form.

sharesInfo.description: Information of the participants with whom the web form has been shared.

widgetParticipantSet.description: Information about the web form participant Set

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant - specific data (email, e.g.). All participants in the array belong to the same set. Currently we are supporting only one member in the set. Since the email of the web form signer is unknown at the time of web form creation, the email should be left empty and its optional security options should be provided.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver, etc.) Web Form First Participant will only have roles - Signer, Approver, Acceptor and Form Filler

deframe.description:
If deframe is false, the resultant page will be shown inside the web form frame. If deframe is true, the resultant page will be shown in the full browser window. 
 Note that in the case of embedded web forms, browser security restrictions do not permit automatic redirection in the full browser window, so if deframe is true the user will instead just see a link to the success page. We recommend this scenario be avoided - in other words, setting deframe to false is recommended for embedded web forms

delay.description:
The delay (in seconds) before the user is taken to the resultant page. If this value is greater than 0, the user will first see the standard Acrobat Sign result message, and then after a delay will be redirected to your resultant page. 
 Note that this parameter has no effect for embedded web forms when deframe is true

url.description:
A publicly accessible url to which the user will be sent after successfully completing the web form. 
If the URL you provide includes information that allows you to identify the specific transaction, such as your own unique identifier, you can use the browser request to this URL as a callback to notify you that this transaction is completed. 
In addition, Acrobat Sign will append a documentKey parameter to the URL which will contain the Acrobat Sign DocumentKey for this signed web form, but only if the sender is the same as the API key user. Your application can use this value to get the form data for this web form

widgetInActiveInfo.description: The custom message which will be displayed to the user or the URL to which user will be redirected when the web form is accessed in a disabled state. This can only be specified in PUT request

embeddedCode.description: Embedded code of url of resource

isCurrent.description: True if this view is the current view

name.description: Name of the requested web form view

commonViewConfiguration.description: Common view configuration for all the available views

name.description: Name of the requested web form view
